p:
In the light of the recent Lancet Commission's call for further research on public health and climate change ( 1), we set out to seek answers on the following five questions through bibliometric searches:
What is the current volume of publications on climate change and health (henceforth abbreviated as CC&H)?
How does this compare with past trends since the very beginning of the field of CC&H, which we set at 1990; the Rio conference; and the signature of the UN Convention on Climate Change ( 15)?
What are the trends through time and current levels of research output by health impact, such as infectious diseases, malnutrition, and so on?
How does the amount of scientific publications compare with other sectors on which climate is known to have an important impact?
What is the geographical distribution of current scientific output on CC&H and how does this compare with the estimated magnitude of health impacts and vulnerability?
